# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is a Julia function that accomplishes this task:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and creates a new column `:ym` in the DataFrame. The values of this new column are calculated by mapping over each value in the `:dt` column, extracting the year and month from each DateTime, and then concatenating them together into an integer format "yyyymm".

You can use it on your given DataFrame like so:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will return a new DataFrame with an additional column `:ym` containing the year and month of each date in "yyyymm" format.
